intro: Crotalaria gajureliana, commonly known as the Indian crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in warm climates. It is often found in agricultural fields and disturbed areas, where it can become a weed. Crotalaria gajureliana has been studied for its potential medicinal properties and its role in soil nitrogen fixation.
